contentrichtext.text: :''For the cruise ship which burned and sank off the Bahamas, see '''[[SS Yarmouth Castle]]'''.'' {{Infobox Military Structure |name=Yarmouth Castle |partof= |location=[[Yarmouth, Isle of Wight|Yarmouth]], [[Isle of Wight]], [[England]] |coordinates= |image= [[File:Yarmouth Castle.JPG|200px]] |caption= Yarmouth Castle |image2= |caption2= |map_type= Isle of Wight |latitude= 50.706667 |longitude= -1.500278 |type= |code= |built= 1547 |builder= |materials= |height= |used= |demolished= |condition= |ownership= [[English Heritage]] |open_to_public=Yes |controlledby= |garrison= |current_commander= |commanders= |occupants= |battles= |events= }} '''Yarmouth Castle''' is a small off-square [[blockhouse]] built by [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] in 1547, to guard [[Yarmouth, Isle of Wight|Yarmouth]] harbour on the [[Isle of Wight]]. It was built as part of Henry's second device programme to fortify the English coast with a chain of coastal defences known as [[Device Forts]] or Henrician Castles. These were built to guard against the threat of foreign invasion. As it is a later fortification it did not have the earlier rounded or concentric shape but a square keep with angular bastions. It is now owned by [[English Heritage]]. ==Further reading== *Colvin, H.M. (ed) (1982). ''The History of the King's Works'', Vol. IV, 1485â€“1600, Part II. *Harrington, Peter (2007). ''The castles of Henry VIII''. Oxford: Osprey. ISBN 978-1-84603-130-4 *Morley, B. M. (1976). ''Henry VIII and the development of coastal defence''. London: H.M. Stationery Office. ISBN 0-11-670777-1 *Rigold, S.E. (2003). ''Yarmouth Castle, Isle of Wight''. London: English Heritage. ==See also== *[[Henry VIII of England#Legacy|Henry VIII: Legacy]] * [[Device Forts]] * [[Martello Tower]] * [[Eastbourne Redoubt]] *[[Pevensey Castle]] * [[Dymchurch Redoubt]] ==External links== {{Commons category|Yarmouth Castle}} *[http://www.pastscape.org.uk/hob.aspx?hob_id=459201&sort=2&type=&typeselect=c&rational=a&class1=None&period=None&county=None&district=None&parish=None&place=&recordsperpage=10&source=text&rtype=monument&rnumber=459201 Read a detailed historical record on Yarmouth Castle] *[http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/daysout/properties/yarmouth-castle/ Page on English Heritage's website] *[http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/publications/yarmouth-castle-info-for-teachers/ Information for teachers: English Heritage] {{Device Forts}} [[Category:Castles on the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:Forts on the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:Device Forts]] [[Category:Visitor attractions on the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:English Heritage sites in the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:Grade I listed buildings on the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:Museums on the Isle of Wight]] [[Category:Military and war museums in England]] {{England-castle-stub}}
